qa_list.question: Who are the authors of this research article?
qa_list.answer: The authors of this research article are William A. Wulf and C. G. Bell.

qa_list.question: Where was this research conducted?
qa_list.answer: This research was conducted at Carnegie-Mellon University in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

qa_list.question: When was the project initiated to design a multi-processor computer system using minicomputer processors?
qa_list.answer: The project was initiated in the Summer of 1971 at Carnegie-Mellon University.

qa_list.question: What is C.mmp and what is it used for?
qa_list.answer: C.mmp stands for a multi-mini-processor, which was designed as part of the project to create a multi-processor computer system using minicomputer processors.

qa_list.question: What is AFIPS '72 (Fall, part II)?
qa_list.answer: AFIPS '72 (Fall, part II) refers to the Proceedings of the December 5-7, 1972 fall joint computer conference, part II.

qa_list.question: When was this research article published?
qa_list.answer: This research article was published on December 5, 1972.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the 'Cite' button in the given text?
qa_list.answer: The 'Cite' button allows users to get citation alerts when a record they have chosen has been cited. It also enables them to save the article, export it as an eReader or PDF, and create a binder.

qa_list.question: What is the main topic of this research paper?
qa_list.answer: The main topic of this research paper is the design and status of a hardware/software complex for a multi-processor computer system using minicomputer processors.

qa_list.question: What are some of the research problems raised in the course of constructing C.mmp?
qa_list.answer: The paper briefly describes an overview (only) of the goals, design, and status of this hardware/software complex, and indicates some of the research problems raised and analytic problems solved in the course of its construction.

qa_list.question: Who are the authors mentioned in this text?
answer: C G Bell, R Cady, H McFarland, B Delagi, J O'Laughlin, R Noonan, W Wulf

qa_list.question: What is the title of the paper presented by C.G. Bell and P. Freeman in 1971?
answer: C.ai: A computing environment for AI Research---Overview, PMS, and operating system considerations

answer: Programmer Reference Manual and Unibus Interface Manual

qa_list.answer: D L Parnas

qa_list.question: Where was the Department of Computer Science located at Carnegie-Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: Pittsburgh

qa_list.question: What is C.ai and what kind of processor does it have?
qa_list.answer: C.ai is a L* processor for the Department of Computer Science at Carnegie-Mellon University.

qa_list.question: Who wrote the paper 'Programming without the goto'?
qa_list.answer: W Wulf

qa_list.question: What is Bliss: A language for systems programming according to the authors of the report?
qa_list.answer: Bliss: A language for systems programming, as per the authors.

qa_list.question: Where was the PhD Dissertation 'An analysis of the instruction execution rate in certain computing structures' written by W D Strecker?
qa_list.answer: Carnegie-Mellon University ARPA Report

qa_list.question: What is the title of the paper that compares price/performance comparison of C.mmp and the PDP-10?
qa_list.answer: Price/performance comparison of C.mmp and the PDP-10

qa_list.question: Who wrote the paper 'Analytic models as aids in multiprocessor design'?
qa_list.answer: J McCredie

qa_list.question: What is the title of the report that compares price/performance comparison of C.mmp and the PDP-10?
qa_list.answer: Price/performance comparison of C.mmp and the PDP-10

qa_list.question: What is the main topic of discussion in the text?
qa_list.answer: The main topic of discussion in the text is a comparison between C.mmp and PDP-10, focusing on their cost/performance advantage.

qa_list.question: According to the analysis presented in the paper, how does C.mmp compare to uniprocessor systems like PDP-10?
qa_list.answer: The analysis shows that a multiprocessor system like C.mmp has a cost/performance advantage of three to four times over uniprocessor systems such as the PDP-10 when similar technologies are used.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose behind dividing buses into groups and reducing bus connections in partial-multiple-bus interconnection networks?
qa_list.answer: The authors address this question by discussing their design and performance analysis of partial-multiple-bus interconnection networks. This evolution from multiple-bus structures aims to improve cost-effectiveness.

qa_list.answer: The text was published in AFIPS '72 (Fall, part II): Proceedings of the December 5-7, 1972, fall joint computer conference, part II. The ISBN is 9781450379137 and the DOI is 10.1145/1480083.

AFIPS '72 (Fall, part II): Proceedings of the December 5-7, 1972, fall joint computer conference, part II

C.mmp: a multi-mini-processor

Pages 765–777

Previous Chapter

Next Chapter

ABSTRACT

In the Summer of 1971 a project was initiated at CMU to design the hardware and software for a multi-processor computer system using minicomputer processors (i.e., PDP-11's). This paper briefly describes an overview (only) of the goals, design, and status of this hardware/software complex, and indicates some of the research problems raised and analytic problems solved in the course of its construction.
